briefdescription.para: The residual quantizer used to encode the vectors.
Access to the actual data.
code size per vector in bytes

detaileddescription.para: Parallel mode determines how queries are parallelized with OpenMP
0 (default): split over queries 1: parallelize over inverted lists 2: parallelize over both 3: split over queries with a finer granularity
PARALLEL_MODE_NO_HEAP_INIT: binary or with the previous to prevent the heap to be initialized and finalized
optional map that maps back ids to invlist entries. This enables reconstruct()
do the codes in the invlists encode the vectors relative to the centroids?

briefdescription.para: vector dimension
total nb of indexed vectors
verbosity level

detaileddescription.para: set if the Index does not require training, or if training is done already

briefdescription.para: type of metric this index uses for search
argument of the metric type
number of probes at query time
max nb of codes to visit to do a query
quantizer that maps vectors to inverted lists
number of inverted lists

detaileddescription.para: = 0: use the quantizer as index in a kmeans training = 1: just pass on the training set to the train() of the quantizer = 2: kmeans training on a flat index + add the centroids to the quantizer

briefdescription.para: whether object owns the quantizer

detaileddescription.para: to override default clustering params

briefdescription.para: to override index used during clustering

memberdef.argsstring: (Index *quantizer, size_t d, size_t nlist, const std::vector< size_t > &nbits, MetricType metric=METRIC_L2, Search_type_t search_type=AdditiveQuantizer::ST_decompress, bool own_invlists=true)
memberdef.name: IndexIVFResidualQuantizer

detaileddescription.para: Constructor.

parameterdescription.para: number of bit per subvector index

memberdef.argsstring: (Index *quantizer, size_t d, size_t nlist, size_t M, size_t nbits, MetricType metric=METRIC_L2, Search_type_t search_type=AdditiveQuantizer::ST_decompress, bool own_invlists=true)
memberdef.name: IndexIVFResidualQuantizer

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, const idx_t *assign) override
memberdef.name: train_encoder

detaileddescription.para: Train the encoder for the vectors.
If by_residual then it is called with residuals and corresponding assign array, otherwise x is the raw training vectors and assign=nullptr

memberdef.argsstring: () const override
memberdef.name: train_encoder_num_vectors

detaileddescription.para: can be redefined by subclasses to indicate how many training vectors they need

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, const idx_t *list_nos, uint8_t *codes, bool include_listnos=false) const override
memberdef.name: encode_vectors

detaileddescription.para: Encodes a set of vectors as they would appear in the inverted lists

parameterdescription.para: inverted list ids as returned by the quantizer (size n). -1s are ignored.
include the list ids in the code (in this case add ceil(log8(nlist)) to the code size)

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const uint8_t *codes, const idx_t *list_nos, float *x) const override
memberdef.name: decode_vectors

detaileddescription.para: Decodes a set of vectors as they would appear in a given set of inverted lists (inverse of encode_vectors)

memberdef.argsstring: (bool store_pairs, const IDSelector *sel, const IVFSearchParameters *params) const override
memberdef.name: get_InvertedListScanner

detaileddescription.para: Get a scanner for this index (store_pairs means ignore labels)
The default search implementation uses this to compute the distances. Use sel instead of params->sel, because sel is initialized with params->sel, but may get overridden by IndexIVF's internal logic.

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const uint8_t *codes, float *x) const override
memberdef.name: sa_decode

detaileddescription.para: decode a set of vectors

parameterdescription.para: input encoded vectors, size n * sa_code_size()

memberdef.argsstring: (int64_t list_no, int64_t offset, float *recons) const override
memberdef.name: reconstruct_from_offset

detaileddescription.para: Reconstruct a vector given the location in terms of (inv list index + inv list offset) instead of the id.
Useful for reconstructing when the direct_map is not maintained and the inv list offset is computed by search_preassigned() with store_pairs set.

memberdef.argsstring: () override
memberdef.name: reset

briefdescription.para: removes all elements from the database.

memberdef.name: search_preassigned

detaileddescription.para: search a set of vectors, that are pre-quantized by the IVF quantizer. Fill in the corresponding heaps with the query results. The default implementation uses InvertedListScanners to do the search.

parameterdescription.para: coarse quantization indices, size nx * nprobe
distances to coarse centroids, size nx * nprobe
store inv list index + inv list offset instead in upper/lower 32 bit of result, instead of ids (used for reranking).
used to override the object's search parameters
search stats to be updated (can be null)

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t nx, const float *x, float radius, const idx_t *keys, const float *coarse_dis, RangeSearchResult *result, bool store_pairs=false, const IVFSearchParameters *params=nullptr, IndexIVFStats *stats=nullptr) const override
memberdef.name: range_search_preassigned

detaileddescription.para: Range search a set of vectors, that are pre-quantized by the IVF quantizer. Fill in the RangeSearchResults results. The default implementation uses InvertedListScanners to do the search.

parameterdescription.para: coarse quantization indices, size nx * nprobe
distances to coarse centroids, size nx * nprobe
store inv list index + inv list offset instead in upper/lower 32 bit of result, instead of ids (used for reranking).
used to override the object's search parameters
search stats to be updated (can be null)

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, idx_t k, float *distances, idx_t *labels, const SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const override

detaileddescription.para: assign the vectors, then call search_preassign

memberdef.name: search

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, float radius, RangeSearchResult *result, const SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const override
memberdef.name: range_search

detaileddescription.para: query n vectors of dimension d to the index.
return all vectors with distance < radius. Note that many indexes do not implement the range_search (only the k-NN search is mandatory).

parameterdescription.para: input vectors to search, size n * d

memberdef.name: reconstruct

detaileddescription.para: reconstruct a vector. Works only if maintain_direct_map is set to 1 or 2

memberdef.argsstring: (int nv, const idx_t *idx, const float *v)
memberdef.name: update_vectors

detaileddescription.para: Update a subset of vectors.
The index must have a direct_map

parameterdescription.para: vector indices to update, size nv
vectors of new values, size nv*d

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t i0, idx_t ni, float *recons) const override
memberdef.name: reconstruct_n

detaileddescription.para: Reconstruct a subset of the indexed vectors.
Overrides default implementation to bypass reconstruct() which requires direct_map to be maintained.

parameterdescription.para: output array of reconstructed vectors, size ni * d

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, idx_t k, float *distances, idx_t *labels, float *recons, const SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const override
memberdef.name: search_and_reconstruct

detaileddescription.para: Similar to search, but also reconstructs the stored vectors (or an approximation in the case of lossy coding) for the search results.
Overrides default implementation to avoid having to maintain direct_map and instead fetch the code offsets through the store_pairs flag in search_preassigned().

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, idx_t k, float *distances, idx_t *labels, uint8_t *recons, bool include_listno=false, const SearchParameters *params=nullptr) const
memberdef.name: search_and_return_codes

detaileddescription.para: Similar to search, but also returns the codes corresponding to the stored vectors for the search results.

parameterdescription.para: include the list ids in the code (in this case add ceil(log8(nlist)) to the code size)

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *x, idx_t *labels, idx_t k=1) const
memberdef.name: assign

detaileddescription.para: return the indexes of the k vectors closest to the query x.

This function is identical as search but only return labels of neighbors.
n
number of vectors
x
input vectors to search, size n * d
labels
output labels of the NNs, size n*k
k
number of nearest neighbours

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const idx_t *keys, float *recons) const

detaileddescription.para: Reconstruct several stored vectors (or an approximation if lossy coding)

this function may not be defined for some indexes
n
number of vectors to reconstruct
keys
ids of the vectors to reconstruct (size n)
recons
reconstucted vector (size n * d)

memberdef.argsstring: (const float *x, float *residual, idx_t key) const
memberdef.name: compute_residual

detaileddescription.para: Computes a residual vector after indexing encoding.

The residual vector is the difference between a vector and the reconstruction that can be decoded from its representation in the index. The residual can be used for multiple-stage indexing methods, like IndexIVF's methods.

parameterdescription.para: encoded index, as returned by search and assign

memberdef.argsstring: (idx_t n, const float *xs, float *residuals, const idx_t *keys) const
memberdef.name: compute_residual_n

detaileddescription.para: Computes a residual vector after indexing encoding (batch form). Equivalent to calling compute_residual for each vector.

The residual vector is the difference between a vector and the reconstruction that can be decoded from its representation in the index. The residual can be used for multiple-stage indexing methods, like IndexIVF's methods.

parameterdescription.para: output residual vectors, size (n x d)
encoded index, as returned by search and assign

memberdef.argsstring: () const
memberdef.name: get_distance_computer

detaileddescription.para: Get a DistanceComputer (defined in AuxIndexStructures) object for this kind of index.
DistanceComputer is implemented for indexes that support random access of their vectors.
